wordpressWpDailyReads.title: June 12 Short Termism, Escalating Tuition and American’s Wealth
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Hi there! We all know that thinking about our finances can be intimidating to say the least, but we at Sherman Wealth Management are here to help you improve your financial well-being. There’s so much information out there, so I wanted to share what I think are the most important reads of the day:

  1. Short Termism is hurting the economy
  2. Escalating tuition and easy credit have yielded a class of student-loan borrowers with spectacular debt they may never pay back
  3. MassMutual Seeks to Raise Long-Term-Care Insurance Rates- Check out your policy to see if you are effected
  4. Americans’ wealth surpassed the $100 trillion mark for the first time in early 2018, as rising home prices offset the hit to households’ assets from a stock-market swoon in the first quarter
  5. How Personalized Financial Advice Can Ease the Retirement Crisis
